ai-mn101:32.1_0: Once they’ve gone forth, they give up the training and livelihood of the mendicants. They renounce the rod and the sword. They’re scrupulous and kind, living full of compassion for all living beings.
ai-mn101:32.2_0: They give up stealing. They take only what’s given, and expect only what’s given. They keep themselves clean by not thieving.
ai-mn101:32.3_0: They give up unchastity. They are celibate, set apart, avoiding the common practice of sex.
ai-mn101:32.4_0: They give up lying. They speak the truth and stick to the truth. They’re honest and trustworthy, and don’t trick the world with their words.
ai-mn101:32.5_1: They don’t repeat in one place what they heard in another so as to divide people against each other. Instead, they reconcile those who are divided, supporting unity, delighting in harmony, loving harmony, speaking words that promote harmony.
ai-mn101:32.6_1: They speak in a way that’s mellow, pleasing to the ear, lovely, going to the heart, polite, likable and agreeable to the people.
ai-mn101:32.7_0: They give up talking nonsense. Their words are timely, true, and meaningful, in line with the teaching and training. They say things at the right time which are valuable, reasonable, succinct, and beneficial.
ai-mn101:32.8_0: They refrain from injuring plants and seeds.
ai-mn101:32.9_0: They eat in one part of the day, abstaining from eating at night and at the wrong time.
ai-mn101:32.10_0: They avoid dancing, singing, music, and seeing shows.
ai-mn101:32.11_0: They avoid beautifying and adorning themselves with garlands, perfumes, and makeup.
ai-mn101:32.12_0: They avoid high and luxurious beds.
ai-mn101:32.13_0: They refrain from receiving gold and money,
ai-mn101:32.22_0: They avoid running errands and messages;
ai-mn101:32.26_0: mutilation, murder, abduction, banditry, plunder, and violence.

ai-mn101:42.2_0: They recollect many kinds of past lives. That is:
ai-mn101:42.2_1: one, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand rebirths.
ai-mn101:42.2_2: They remember: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food.
ai-mn101:42.2_3: They remember: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn somewhere else. There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ And so they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.
ai-mn101:42.3_0: That’s how exertion and striving is fruitful.
ai-mn101:43.1_0: When their mind has become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—they extend it toward knowledge of the death and rebirth of sentient beings.
ai-mn101:43.2_0: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, they see sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds:
ai-mn101:43.2_1: ‘These dear beings did bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-mn101:43.2_2: They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-mn101:43.2_3: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell. These dear beings, however, did good things by way of body, speech, and mind. They never spoke ill of the noble ones; they had right view; and they chose to act out of that right view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’ And so, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, they see sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.
ai-mn101:43.3_0: That’s how exertion and striving is fruitful.
ai-mn101:44.1_0: When their mind has become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—they extend it toward knowledge of the ending of defilements.
ai-mn101:44.2_0: But they truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ ...
ai-mn101:44.3_0: He truly understands: ‘These are defilements’ ... ‘This is the origin of defilements’ ... ‘This is the cessation of defilements’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of defilements’.
ai-mn101:45.1_0: Knowing and seeing like this, their mind is freed from the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.
ai-mn101:45.2_0: When it is freed, he knows it is freed.
ai-mn101:45.3_0: He understands: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
ai-mn101:45.4_0: That too is how exertion and striving is fruitful.
ai-mn101:46.1_0: Such is the doctrine of the Realized One.
ai-mn101:46.2_0: Saying this, the Realized One deserves praise on ten legitimate grounds.
ai-mn101:46.3_0: If sentient beings experience pleasure and pain because of past deeds,
ai-mn101:46.4_0: clearly the Realized One has done good deeds in the past, since he now experiences such undefiled pleasure.
ai-mn101:46.5_0: If sentient beings experience pleasure and pain because of the Lord God’s creation,
ai-mn101:46.6_0: clearly the Realized One was created by a good God, since he now experiences such undefiled pleasure.
ai-mn101:46.8_0: clearly the Realized One arises from good circumstances, since he now experiences such undefiled pleasure.
ai-mn101:46.9_0: If sentient beings experience pleasure and pain because of the class of rebirth,
ai-mn101:46.10_0: clearly the Realized One was reborn in a good class, since he now experiences such undefiled pleasure.
ai-mn101:46.11_0: If sentient beings experience pleasure and pain because of exertion in the present,
ai-mn101:46.12_0: clearly the Realized One exerts himself well in the present, since he now experiences such undefiled pleasure.
ai-mn101:46.13_0: The Realized One deserves praise whether or not sentient beings experience pleasure and pain because of past deeds,
ai-mn101:46.20_0: or if they don’t experience pleasure and pain because of the Realized One,
ai-mn101:46.23_0: Such is the doctrine of the Realized One.
ai-mn101:46.24_0: Saying this, the Realized One deserves praise on these ten legitimate grounds.”
ai-mn101:46.25_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn101:46.26_0: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-mn101:46.27_0: The first section on Devadatta is finished.
